alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 12:03PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Imperial. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At noon PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain occurring. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inches are expected over the area for the next few hours. This additional rain will continue the minor flooding threat. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Centro, Calexico, Brawley, Imperial, Plaster City, Ocotillo, Holtville, Westmorland, El Centro Naval Airfield, Mt. Signal, Mountain Spring, Calipatria, Slab City, Seeley, Dixieland, Alamorio, Wiest, Heber, Coyote Wells and Niland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
